intro: Draba oxyloba, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear cress, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its simple, basal leaves and small white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Draba oxyloba is known for its short stature and ability to survive in harsh, high-altitude conditions. Its flowers bloom in early spring, contributing to the biodiversity of its mountainous habitat.
